page.title: 05WITHINGTON EDUCATION.
page.content: The school's catchment area is the parish of Withington although some children attend from the neighbouring villages of Compton Abdale, Hazleton and Shipton. At the age of eleven children sit their "J.4 Test" to determine which secondary school they may attend. Depending on the results of this test children transfer to either Westwoods Grammar School at Northleach or to Charlton Kings Secondary Modern School Cheltenham. In September 1986 the Charlton Kings School will become a comprehensive school. Discussions are still taking place about the future of Westwoods School which may be almalgamated with a school at Bourton to become a comprehensive school as well.Children are taken to both schools by buses provided by the Education Authority.
